sentences.chinese: …幻灯机。

sentences.english: When you define the project, you make sure that you have an agreement with the project sponsor on what work should be completed in this project.
sentences.chinese: 在你定义项目的时候，你要确保和项目发起人在项目应该完成的所有工作内容上达成一致意见。

sentences.chinese: 发起人必须真正认可项目的价值，这一点很重要，只有这样才能确保在推广没有立即见效时资金和支持不会随之消失。

sentences.english: Most of his poems are variations on the theme of love.
sentences.chinese: 他的大部分诗作都是有关爱情主题的形式不同的作品。

sentences.english: After a few days of fever, she began to recover.
sentences.chinese: 发烧几天之后，她开始恢复。

sentences.chinese: 残骸中找到了两具尸体

sentences.chinese: 一位著名的新闻记者兼播音员

sentences.english: Local legend has it that (= says that ) the island was the original Garden of Eden.
sentences.chinese: 当地传说这个岛就是伊甸园的原型。

sentences.english: He was fairly easily persuaded .
sentences.chinese: 他很轻易就被说服了。

sentences.english: We must consider how best to utilize what resources we have.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须考虑怎样充分利用现有的资源。

sentences.chinese: 他的伟大成就在于把所有选手组织成一支团结的队伍。

sentences.chinese: 船长正在调他的望远镜。

sentences.chinese: 我们种植玉米和西瓜。

detailed_translations.english: a building,  statue  , or other large structure that is built to remind people of an important event or famous person

sentences.english: The meaning of ‘mad’ depends on its context.

sentences.chinese: 飞机坠毁，造成两名机组人员和四名乘客死亡。

sentences.chinese: 艾尔弗雷德雄心勃勃，一心想着发财。

sentences.chinese: 他为了健康而迁居海滨。

sentences.english: Locally and from the state standpoint, we had some firefighter jobs that were in jeopardy, up in the hundreds.

sentences.chinese: 然后继续前往一个营地，在那里会有骆驼恭候大驾。

sentences.chinese: 湖水冻得结结实实。

sentences.chinese: 正如一位当地居民在五月份对它的描述”白天有政府。

sentences.chinese: 他被看成是近代最成功的总统。

sentences.chinese: 我们力求为所有的客户提供物有所值的商品和服务。

sentences.english: We were both experienced sailors.
sentences.chinese: 我们两个都是经验丰富的水手。

detailed_translations.english: someone who works on a ship

sentences.english: The kids were screaming with delight.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们在高兴地尖叫。

sentences.english: He is delighting audiences with his wit and humour.
sentences.chinese: 他在用自己的智慧和幽默娱乐观众。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of great pleasure and satisfaction
to give someone great satisfaction and enjoyment

sentences.english: He earns nearly £20,000 a year.
sentences.chinese: 他每年挣近20,000英镑。

sentences.english: You don’t earn much money being a nurse.
sentences.chinese: 当护士挣钱并不多。

sentences.chinese: 他为谋生什么活都干。

sentences.english: I was the only person in the house who was earning.
sentences.chinese: 我是家里唯一上班挣钱的人。

sentences.english: She was earning good money at the bank.
sentences.chinese: 她在银行工作，收入不错。

sentences.english: You could earn a higher rate of interest elsewhere.
sentences.chinese: 你在别处可以获得更高的利率。

detailed_translations.english: to receive a particular amount of money for the work that you do

sentences.english: It was the worst day in my entire life.
sentences.chinese: 那是我一生中最糟糕的一天。

sentences.english: The entire staff agreed.
sentences.chinese: 全体员工都同意了。

sentences.english: Have you drunk the entire bottle?
sentences.chinese: 你把整瓶酒都喝了吗？

detailed_translations.english: used when you want to emphasize that you mean all of a group, period of time, amount etc

sentences.english: Newspapers vary in the degree to which they emphasize propaganda rather than information.
sentences.chinese: 报纸重宣传轻资讯的程度各不相同。

detailed_translations.english: the level or amount of something

sentences.english: a graduate student
sentences.chinese: 研究生

detailed_translations.english: relating to or involved in studies done at a university after completing a first degree
to obtain a degree, especially a first degree, from a college or university
someone who has completed a university degree, especially a first degree

sentences.english: a 55 mph speed limit
sentences.chinese: 55英里的时速限制

sentences.english: The public is not allowed within a 2-mile limit of the missile site.
sentences.chinese: 众不得进入导弹发射场两英里范围内。

detailed_translations.english: the greatest or least amount, number, speed etc that is allowed

sentences.english: We can’t afford to wait any longer or we’ll miss the plane.
sentences.chinese: 我们再也不能等下去了，否则会赶不上飞机的。

sentences.english: The room affords a beautiful view over the city.
sentences.chinese: 这房间可以俯瞰城市美景。

sentences.english: The new law will afford protection to employees.
sentences.chinese: 新法律将为雇员提供保障。

detailed_translations.english: if you cannot afford to do something, you must not do it because it could cause serious problems for you

sentences.english: Morris has a private jet.
sentences.chinese: 莫里斯拥有一架私人喷气式飞机。

sentences.english: He made some notes for his private use.
sentences.chinese: 他记了些笔记供自己所用。

sentences.english: They objected to any form of private property .
sentences.chinese: 他们反对任何形式的私有财产。

detailed_translations.english: for use by one person or group, not for everyone

sentences.english: a family portrait
sentences.chinese: 全家福

sentences.english: She’s been commissioned to paint Jackson’s portrait .
sentences.chinese: 她已受托为杰克逊画肖像。

detailed_translations.english: a painting, drawing, or photograph of a person

sentences.english: Class enrollment, where each student has all of the course schedule selections, each student having his own bucket in the CGTT.
sentences.chinese: 班级入学，每个学生都有所有的课程安排选择，每个学生都将自己的选择放在 CGTT 中。

sentences.english: a pint of beer
sentences.chinese: 一品脱啤酒

sentences.english: We sell draught beer (=  beer served from a large container, not a bottle  ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们出售散装啤酒。

detailed_translations.english: an alcoholic drink made from  malt  and  hop s

name: prior
trans: 优先的，在前的；更重要的

sentences.english: You do not need any prior knowledge of the subject.
sentences.chinese: 你无需事先具备该方面的知识。

sentences.english: Changes may not be made without the prior approval of the council.
sentences.chinese: 未经委员会事先同意，不得作出改变。

sentences.english: Vegetarian meals are provided by prior agreement.
sentences.chinese: 经事先协商可提供素食。

sentences.english: Some prior experience with the software is needed.
sentences.chinese: 要求事先熟悉这个软件。

detailed_translations.english: existing or arranged before something else or before the present situation

sentences.english: The river is too dangerous to navigate.
sentences.chinese: 这河道太危险，不适宜航行。

detailed_translations.english: to sail along a river or other area of water

sentences.english: Check the tiles carefully before you buy them.
sentences.chinese: 购买之前要把瓷砖仔细检查一下。

sentences.english: A first rule in solving any mystery is to check the facts.
sentences.chinese: 揭开谜团的第一条规则是核查事实。

sentences.english: The police are failing to take adequate measures to check the growth in crime.
sentences.chinese: 警方未能采取适当的措施来阻止犯罪率上升。

sentences.english: Conduct regular checks on your water quality.
sentences.chinese: 要经常检查水质。

detailed_translations.english: to do something in order to find out whether something really is correct, true, or in good condition
the process of finding out if something is safe, correct, true, or in the condition it should be

sentences.english: an enthusiastic supporter of reform
sentences.chinese: 改革的热心支持者

detailed_translations.english: feeling or showing a lot of interest and excitement about something

sentences.english: They would inform him of any progress they had made.
sentences.chinese: 他们将把自己所取得的任何进展都告诉他。

sentences.english: My daughter informed me that she was pregnant.
sentences.chinese: 我女儿告诉我她怀孕了。

detailed_translations.english: If you inform someone of something, you tell them about it
to officially tell someone about something or give them information

name: rather
trans: than，宁可…也不愿；与其…倒不如

sentences.english: I grew up in rather unusual circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 我在相当不寻常的环境中长大。

sentences.english: I'm afraid it's a rather long story.
sentences.chinese: 我恐怕这是个相当长的故事。

sentences.english: I’d rather have a quiet night in front of the TV.
sentences.chinese: 我宁愿晚上安安静静地看看电视。

detailed_translations.english: fairly or to some degree

sentences.chinese: 不可能仅通过说某个词或短语就能把人催眠。

sentences.english: Who first used the phrase ‘survival of the fittest’?
sentences.chinese: “适者生存”这一说法最早是谁说的？

sentences.english: Shakespeare’s plays are full of well-known phrases .
sentences.chinese: 莎士比亚的戏剧中写满了众所周知的名言警句。

detailed_translations.english: a group of words without a finite verb, especially when they are used to form part of a sentence, such as ‘walking along the road’ and ‘a bar of soap’

sentences.english: They went into town with the intention of visiting the library.
sentences.chinese: 他们进了城，打算参观图书馆。

detailed_translations.english: a plan or desire to do something

sentences.english: a dynamic and unstable process
sentences.chinese: 不断变化的、不稳定的过程

detailed_translations.chinese: 有活力的；动力的；不断变化的
detailed_translations.english: continuously moving or changing
something that causes action or change

sentences.english: Your button has dropped off.
sentences.chinese: 你的纽扣掉了。

sentences.english: The number of deaths on the roads has dropped sharply.
sentences.chinese: 交通事故死亡人数已大大减少。

detailed_translations.english: to fall suddenly onto the ground or into something

sentences.english: Applicants must provide supporting documentation .
sentences.chinese: 申请人必须提供证明文件。

detailed_translations.chinese: 文件, 证明文件, 史实, 文件编制
detailed_translations.english: official documents, reports etc that are used to prove that something is true or correct

sentences.english: He used his influence to get his son into medical school.
sentences.chinese: 他利用权势把儿子弄进了医学院。

sentences.english: He denies exerting any political influence over them.
sentences.chinese: 他否认曾向他们施加过政治影响。

detailed_translations.english: the power to make other people agree with your opinions or do what you want

name: manage
trans: 管理；经营；做成；设法对付

sentences.english: He was asked to manage a new department.
sentences.chinese: 他被要求去管理一个新的部门。

sentences.english: Managing a football team is harder than you think.
sentences.chinese: 管理一支足球队比你想象的要难。

sentences.english: The company had been very badly managed.
sentences.chinese: 公司管理非常糟糕。

sentences.english: I don’t know how I’ll manage it , but I’ll be there.
sentences.chinese: 我还不知道怎么去，但我会去的。

sentences.english: I don’t know how she manages with seven children.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道七个孩子她是怎么应付的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 管理；设法；成功应付，对付
detailed_translations.english: to direct or control a business or department and the people, equipment, and money involved in it

name: incorporate
trans: 合并；组成公司；合并的；公

sentences.english: It allows you to harness existing technologies and incorporate them into one application.
sentences.chinese: 它允许您利用现有的技术并将它们合并到同一个应用程序中。

sentences.english: The next step is to generate the report and then incorporate it as an affiliated document of the master document.
sentences.chinese: 紧接着的步骤就是产生这个报告，然后将它作为主文档的附属文档与主文档合并。

sentences.english: The public expect high standards from any large organization.
sentences.chinese: 公众对任何大型机构都期望很高。

sentences.english: the World Trade Organization
sentences.chinese: 世界贸易组织

sentences.english: a voluntary organization which helps disabled people with their transport needs
sentences.chinese: 帮助残疾人士满足其交通需求的一个志愿组织

sentences.english: an illegal terrorist organization
sentences.chinese: 非法的恐怖组织

sentences.english: international organizations such as the UN
sentences.chinese: 诸如联合国之类的国际组织

detailed_translations.english: a group such as a club or business that has formed for a particular purpose

sentences.english: Was my name mentioned at all?
sentences.chinese: 我的名字被提到过吗？

sentences.english: Some of the problems were mentioned in his report.
sentences.chinese: 其中的一些问题在他的报告里提到了。

sentences.english: (= it is important enough to mention ) that they only studied a very small number of cases.
sentences.chinese: 必须说明的是他们仅研究了几个个案。

sentences.english: As I mentioned earlier , there have been a lot of changes recently.
sentences.chinese: 正如我刚才所说的，最近变化很大。

sentences.english: She mentioned in passing (= mentioned in a quick unimportant way ) that you had just been to Rome.
sentences.chinese: 她只是随口提了一下你刚刚去过罗马。

sentences.english: They all get a mention (= they are all mentioned ) in the book.
sentences.chinese: 他们在书中全都被提到了。

detailed_translations.english: to talk or write about something or someone, usually quickly and without saying very much or giving details
when someone mentions something or someone in a conversation, piece of writing etc

sentences.english: I promise I will do my duty .
sentences.chinese: 我保证会尽到我的责任。

sentences.english: We feel it is our duty to help her.
sentences.chinese: 我们感到帮助她是我们的责任。

sentences.english: Local authorities have a duty to keep the streets clean.
sentences.chinese: 地方当局有责任保持街道整洁。

sentences.english: You have a duty to your husband and to your children.
sentences.chinese: 你对你丈夫和孩子负有责任。

sentences.english: She has a strong sense of moral duty .
sentences.chinese: 她的道德责任感很强。

sentences.english: Martin’s duties included cleaning the cars.
sentences.chinese: 马丁的职责包括清洗汽车。

sentences.english: the duty on cigarettes
sentences.chinese: 香烟税

detailed_translations.english: something that you have to do because it is morally or legally right

sentences.english: Diseases were spread through poor sanitary conditions .
sentences.chinese: 疾病因卫生条件很差而传播开来。

sentences.english: a prison with no proper sanitary facilities
sentences.chinese: 一座缺少适当卫生设施的监狱

sentences.chinese: 吉卜赛人的大篷车

detailed_translations.chinese: （可供居住的）拖车，大篷车；（穿过沙漠地带的）旅行队（如商队）；<英>活动住宅；<美>移民列车
detailed_translations.english: a vehicle that a car can pull and in which people can live and sleep when they are on holiday

detailed_translations.chinese: 乘拖车度假；参加旅行队旅行

sentences.english: One solution is to retrain the long-term unemployed.
sentences.chinese: 一个解决办法是对长期失业的人进行再培训。

detailed_translations.english: to learn or to teach someone the skills that are needed to do a different job

sentences.english: ...a vase of red roses.
sentences.chinese: …一个插着红玫瑰的花瓶。

detailed_translations.english: a container used to put flowers in or for decoration

sentences.english: Pete, are you going to make the introductions?
sentences.chinese: 皮特，你来作一下介绍吧。

sentences.english: Our first contestant needs no introduction (= everyone already knows the person ).
sentences.chinese: 我们的第一位参赛者就不用介绍了。

sentences.english: the introduction of Buddhism to China nearly 2,000 years ago
sentences.chinese: 约2,000年前佛教传入中国

sentences.english: In the introduction, he explains why he wrote the book.
sentences.chinese: 在引言里，他解释了写这本书的原因。

detailed_translations.english: the act of formally telling two people each other’s names when they first meet

sentences.chinese: 用茶匙把面团舀到一张烘培纸上。

detailed_translations.english: a small spoon that you use for mixing sugar into tea and coffee

sentences.english: It was too dark to search further.
sentences.chinese: 天太暗，无法继续寻找。

sentences.english: The area was thoroughly searched .
sentences.chinese: 这一地区已被彻底搜查过。

sentences.english: I’ve searched high and low (= everywhere ) for my glasses.
sentences.chinese: 我到处找我的眼镜。

detailed_translations.english: to try to find someone or something by looking very carefully
an attempt to find someone or something

sentences.english: We ran for cover as shells dropped all around us.
sentences.chinese: 周围炮弹四处飞落，我们奔跑着寻找地方躲避。

sentences.english: an exploding mortar shell
sentences.chinese: 一枚爆炸的迫击炮弹

detailed_translations.english: a metal container, like a large bullet, which is full of an explosive substance and is fired from a large gun

detailed_translations.chinese: 剥落；设定命令行解释器的位置
detailed_translations.english: to remove something such as beans or nuts from a shell or  pod

sentences.english: She’s got two daughters and one son.
sentences.chinese: 她有两个女儿和一个儿子。

sentences.english: our eldest daughter
sentences.chinese: 我们的长女

detailed_translations.english: someone’s female child

sentences.english: a reasonable request
sentences.chinese: 合情合理的要求

sentences.english: Be reasonable — you can’t expect her to do all the work on her own!
sentences.chinese: 要讲道理，你不能指望她一个人干所有的工作！

sentences.english: I thought it was a perfectly reasonable (= completely reasonable ) question.
sentences.chinese: 我认为这个问题问得很有道理。

sentences.english: He had reasonable grounds (= good reasons but no proof ) for believing the law had been broken.
sentences.chinese: 他有合理的根据认为有人违法了。

sentences.english: good food at a reasonable price
sentences.chinese: 价格公道的美食

detailed_translations.english: fair and sensible

sentences.english: Nearly 70 percent of the population still live in the countryside.
sentences.chinese: 人口中差不多有70%仍住在乡村。

sentences.english: Most of the world’s population doesn’t get enough to eat.
sentences.chinese: 世界上大多数人都吃不饱。

detailed_translations.english: the number of people living in a particular area, country etc

sentences.english: There were many more deaths than was first supposed.
sentences.chinese: 死亡人数远远超过最初的预料。

sentences.english: There's no reason to suppose (= it is unlikely that ) he’s lying.
sentences.chinese: 没有理由认为他在说谎。

detailed_translations.english: to think that something is probably true, based on what you know

sentences.english: He tied the ends of the plastic bag together.
sentences.chinese: 他把塑料袋的两头系在一起。

detailed_translations.english: if two players, teams etc tie or are tied in a game or competition, they finish it with an equal number of points

detailed_translations.chinese: 领带；平局；鞋带；领结；不分胜负
detailed_translations.english: a long narrow piece of cloth tied in a knot around the neck, worn by men

sentences.english: Sam’s about the same height as his sister now.
sentences.chinese: 萨姆现在身高和他姐姐差不多了。

sentences.english: State your age, height, and weight.
sentences.chinese: 说出你的年龄、身高和体重。

sentences.english: Rachel had always been scared of heights.
sentences.chinese: 雷切尔过去一直恐高。

detailed_translations.english: how tall someone or something is

sentences.english: a covered terrace extending the full width of the house
sentences.chinese: 和房子同宽的有顶露台

detailed_translations.english: the distance from one side of something to the other

sentences.english: The dog bit him and made his hand bleed.
sentences.chinese: 那只狗把他的手咬出血了。

sentences.english: The dog’s been badly bitten by fleas.
sentences.chinese: 狗被跳蚤咬得很厉害。

detailed_translations.english: to use your teeth to cut, crush, or chew something

sentences.english: Stay for supper – I insist!
sentences.chinese: 留下来吃晚餐——一定的！

detailed_translations.english: to demand that something should happen

sentences.english: He had a strong Irish accent
sentences.chinese: 他有浓重的爱尔兰口音。

detailed_translations.chinese: 口音；重音；强调；特点；重音符号
detailed_translations.english: the way someone pronounces the words of a language, showing which country or which part of a country they come from
to make something more noticeable so that people will pay attention to it

sentences.english: a healthy baby boy
sentences.chinese: 健康的男婴

sentences.english: I’ve always been perfectly healthy until now.
sentences.chinese: 直到现在，我的身体一直非常健康。

sentences.english: a healthy lifestyle
sentences.chinese: 健康的生活方式

detailed_translations.english: physically strong and not likely to become ill or weak

sentences.english: The files need updating.
sentences.chinese: 这些档案需要更新。

detailed_translations.english: to add the most recent information to something
the most recent news or information about something

name: perishable
trans: 易腐烂的（东西，尤指食物）

sentences.english: perishable goods such as butter, milk, fruit and fish
sentences.chinese: 黄油、牛奶、水果和鱼等易变质的商品

detailed_translations.chinese: 易腐坏的；易毁灭的；会枯萎的
detailed_translations.english: food that is perishable is likely to decay quickly

sentences.english: The book’s theme is the conflict between love and duty.
sentences.chinese: 本书的主题是爱与责任之间的冲突。

sentences.english: Freia’s theme in Wagner’s opera
sentences.chinese: 瓦格纳歌剧中的弗莱雅主旋律

detailed_translations.chinese: 题目；主题；主旋律；（句子的）主位；词干
detailed_translations.english: the main subject or idea in a piece of writing, speech, film etc

sentences.english: the gun-control debate in the US
sentences.chinese: 美国有关控制枪支的争论

sentences.english: The new drug has become the subject of heated debate within the medical profession.
sentences.chinese: 这种新药成了医学界激烈争论的话题。

sentences.english: There was much lively debate about whether women should spend more time in the home.
sentences.chinese: 就妇女是否应该花更多时间待在家里这个话题有许多热烈的争论。

sentences.english: A fierce debate raged over which artist’s work should be chosen for the prize.
sentences.chinese: 就哪位艺术家的作品应该得奖一事展开了激烈的争论。

sentences.english: The issue will be debated on Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题将在星期二讨论。

detailed_translations.english: discussion of a particular subject that often continues for a long time and in which people express different opinions
to discuss a subject formally when you are trying to make a decision or find a solution

sentences.english: Careless drivers hazard other people's lives as well as their own.
sentences.chinese: 粗心大意的驾驶者拿他人和自己的生命冒险。

sentences.english: Polluted water sources are a hazard to wildlife.
sentences.chinese: 受污染的水源会对野生生物构成危险。

detailed_translations.english: to risk sth or put it in danger
something that may be dangerous, or cause accidents or problems

sentences.english: Gorbachev failed to keep the component parts of the Soviet Union together.
sentences.chinese: 戈尔巴乔夫没能使苏联各组成部分保持在一起。

detailed_translations.english: the component parts of something are the parts that it consists of
one of several parts that together make up a whole machine, system etc

sentences.english: The most important criterion for entry is that applicants must design and make their own work.
sentences.chinese: 参加的最重要标准就是申请人必须设计并制作自己的作品。

detailed_translations.english: A criterion is a factor on which you judge or decide something

sentences.english: The rise in crime is mainly due to social and economic factors.
sentences.chinese: 犯罪率上升主要由社会和经济因素造成。

detailed_translations.chinese: 因素， 因子； 系数
detailed_translations.english: one of several things that influence or cause a situation

sentences.chinese: 那对夫妇想收养他们代养的一个黑人小孩。

sentences.english: Hong Kong is a Chinese territory.
sentences.chinese: 香港是中国的领土。

sentences.english: The company is moving into unfamiliar territory with this new software.
sentences.chinese: 该公司正通过这种新软件进入一个不熟悉的领域。

detailed_translations.english: land that is owned or controlled by a particular country, ruler, or military force

sentences.english: I can't abide people with no sense of humour.
sentences.chinese: 我讨厌和没有幽默感的人打交道。

sentences.english: You'll have to abide by the rules of the club.
sentences.chinese: 你必须遵守俱乐部的规定。

detailed_translations.english: bear, stand

sentences.english: Looking after the house was viewed as a woman’s domain.
sentences.chinese: 料理家务被认为是女性的份内之事。

detailed_translations.english: an area of activity, interest, or knowledge, especially one that a particular person, organization etc deals with

sentences.english: Do you like its flavor?
sentences.chinese: 你喜欢它的味道吗?。

sentences.english: When things had flavor , we knew what we were eating all the while ----and it satisfied us .
sentences.chinese: 当食物有滋味的时候，我们从头到尾都知道自己吃的是什么，从中得到满足。

sentences.english: I consider the eels to be the best quality protein in my line—a very unique flavor of fish, applewood smoke, and a momentary lingering of dark, fall honey.
sentences.chinese: 我认为，在我的行当里，鳗鱼是最优质的蛋白质——一种非常独特的风味鱼，用苹果木烟熏，在暗处晾一会，再抹上秋天的蜂蜜。

sentences.english: People migrate to cities like Jakarta in search of work.
sentences.chinese: 人们移居到雅加达这样的城市找工作。

sentences.english: Most birds have to fly long distances to migrate.
sentences.chinese: 大多数的鸟类不得不飞行很长的距离进行迁徙。

detailed_translations.english: if people migrate, they go to live in another area or country, especially in order to find work

sentences.english: A good teacher has to be able to motivate her students.
sentences.chinese: 好教师必须能够激发学生的积极性。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone want to achieve something and make them willing to work hard in order to do this

sentences.english: When approving a merger, the commission can attach conditions.
sentences.chinese: 委员会在批准公司合并时可能附加条件。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缚， 系， 贴， 附加； 使依恋， 使喜爱； 使附属； 认为有
detailed_translations.english: to allow something to happen, but only if someone agrees to do a particular thing or accept a particular idea

sentences.english: Each person’s fingerprints are unique.
sentences.chinese: 每个人的指纹都是独一无二的。

detailed_translations.english: being the only one of its kind

sentences.english: a stress fracture in his left knee
sentences.chinese: 他左膝上的应力性骨折

sentences.english: a hairline fracture
sentences.chinese: 细小的裂缝

sentences.english: The immense pressure causes the rock to fracture.
sentences.chinese: 巨大的压力造成岩石断裂。

detailed_translations.english: a crack or broken part in a bone or other hard substance
if a bone or other hard substance fractures, or if it is fractured, it breaks or cracks

sentences.english: She demanded payment in advance.
sentences.chinese: 她要求预先付款。

sentences.english: Payment can be made by cheque or credit card.
sentences.chinese: 可以用支票或信用卡付款。

detailed_translations.english: the act of paying for something

sentences.english: We crept carefully along the narrow ledge.
sentences.chinese: 我们小心翼翼地沿着狭窄的岩架爬行。

sentences.english: He leapt onto a ledge of rock.
sentences.chinese: 他跳到一个岩架上。

detailed_translations.english: a narrow flat piece of rock that sticks out on the side of a mountain or cliff

sentences.english: ..familiar idioms and metaphors, such as "turning over a new leaf.
sentences.chinese: …如“翻开新的一页”这样熟悉的习语和比喻。

detailed_translations.english: a group of words that has a special meaning that is different from the ordinary meaning of each separate word. For example, ‘under the weather’ is an idiom meaning ‘ill’.

sentences.english: There was a complimentary bottle of champagne in the hotel room.
sentences.chinese: 酒店客房里有一瓶免费赠送的香槟。

sentences.english: I’ve got some complimentary tickets for the theatre tonight.
sentences.chinese: 我有几张今晚的免费戏票。

detailed_translations.english: given free to people

sentences.english: Students have to reach a certain standard or they won’t pass.
sentences.chinese: 学生必须达到某一标准，否则无法通过。

sentences.english: The airline has rigorous safety standards.
sentences.chinese: 这家航空公司有严格的安全标准。

detailed_translations.chinese: 标准；水准；旗；度量衡标准
detailed_translations.english: the level that is considered to be acceptable, or the level that someone or something has achieved

detailed_translations.chinese: 标准的；合规格的；公认为优秀的
detailed_translations.english: accepted as normal or usual

sentences.english: He was a drummer in a rock band.
sentences.chinese: 他是一支摇滚乐队的鼓手。

detailed_translations.english: someone who plays drums

sentences.english: a victory parade
sentences.chinese: 胜利游行

sentences.english: the St Patrick’s Day parade
sentences.chinese: 圣帕特里克节庆祝游行

sentences.english: a military parade
sentences.chinese: 军事检阅

sentences.english: The marchers paraded peacefully through the capital.
sentences.chinese: 游行队伍有秩序地列队穿过首都。

detailed_translations.english: a public celebration when musical bands, brightly decorated vehicles etc move down the street
to walk or march together to celebrate or protest about something

sentences.english: Smoking is strictly prohibited inside the factory.
sentences.chinese: 厂区严禁吸烟。

detailed_translations.english: to say that an action is illegal or not allowed

sentences.english: People who are wrongly arrested may be paid compensation .
sentences.chinese: 被误抓的人有可能得到补偿费。

detailed_translations.english: money paid to someone because they have suffered injury or loss, or because something they own has been damaged

sentences.english: There is a certain logic in their choice of architect.
sentences.chinese: 他们对建筑师的选择是有一定道理的。

detailed_translations.english: a way of thinking about something that seems correct and reasonable, or a set of sensible reasons for doing something

sentences.english: The island is only accessible by boat.
sentences.chinese: 这个岛只有坐船才能到。

sentences.english: There is a church which is easily accessible from my home.
sentences.chinese: 有座教堂离我家很近。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易接近的；可进入的；可理解的
detailed_translations.english: a place, building, or object that is accessible is easy to reach or get into

sentences.english: Foster joined in the laughter.
sentences.chinese: 福斯特也跟着笑了起来。

sentences.english: He looked shocked, then burst into laughter (= started laughing ).
sentences.chinese: 他一脸的震惊，接着便放声大笑起来。

detailed_translations.english: when people laugh, or the sound of people laughing

sentences.english: His bad behaviour was just an isolated incident.
sentences.chinese: 他的不良行为只是个别事件。

sentences.english: Roads were sealed off because of a major incident.
sentences.chinese: 因为发生重大事故，道路被封锁了。

detailed_translations.english: something that happens, especially sth unusual or unpleasant

sentences.english: Called up for military service, Mr. Marokvia spent the war as an illustrator for the Wehrmacht, applying brush and pencil in Ukraine, Italy, Finland and Yugoslavia.
sentences.chinese: 玛洛克维亚先生被征召入伍，他作为一名德国国防军的插图画家，在乌克兰、意大利、芬兰和南斯拉夫留下了自己的墨迹。

detailed_translations.english: someone who draws pictures, especially for books

sentences.english: A full day’s teaching exhausts me.
sentences.chinese: 讲一整天课令我精疲力竭。

sentences.english: We are in danger of exhausting the world’s oil supply.
sentences.chinese: 我们面临世界石油储备耗尽的危险。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel extremely tired

sentences.english: Marijuana can provide pain relief for some cancer patients.
sentences.chinese: 大麻可以为一些癌症患者减轻疼痛。

sentences.english: money raised for the relief effort
sentences.chinese: 为赈灾筹集的钱款

detailed_translations.english: when something reduces someone’s pain or unhappy feelings

sentences.english: a trivial detail
sentences.chinese: 细枝末节

sentences.english: I know it sounds trivial , but I'm worried about it.
sentences.chinese: 我知道这事听起来微不足道，但我还是放心不下。

detailed_translations.english: not important or serious; not worth considering

sentences.english: a silk blouse
sentences.chinese: 丝质女衬衫

detailed_translations.english: a shirt for women

sentences.english: A potato has about 90 calories.
sentences.chinese: 一个马铃薯大约有90卡路里的热量。

sentences.english: a calorie-controlled diet
sentences.chinese: 控制热量的日常饮食

sentences.english: I need to burn off a few calories (= lose some weight by exercising ) .
sentences.chinese: 我要消耗掉一些卡路里。

sentences.english: My wife convinced me to finally start counting calories (= control my weight by being careful about what I eat ) .
sentences.chinese: 我妻子终于说服我开始计算卡路里、控制体重。

detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring the amount of  energy  that food will produce

sentences.english: When water boils, bubbles rise to the surface.
sentences.chinese: 水烧开时，水面会冒泡泡。

sentences.english: soap bubbles
sentences.chinese: 肥皂泡

sentences.english: She was blowing bubbles in her milk with a straw.
sentences.chinese: 她用吸管在牛奶里吹泡泡。

sentences.english: Heat the cheese until it bubbles.
sentences.chinese: 把奶酪加热到冒泡。

detailed_translations.english: a ball of air or gas in liquid
to produce bubbles

sentences.english: The investigation continued for nearly three years.
sentences.chinese: 调查持续了近三年。

sentences.english: a criminal investigation
sentences.chinese: 刑事调查

sentences.english: A private detective was hired to conduct the investigation.
sentences.chinese: 雇了一名私人侦探进行调查。

detailed_translations.english: an official attempt to find out the truth about or the cause of something such as a crime, accident, or scientific problem

sentences.english: a UN agency responsible for helping refugees
sentences.chinese: 负责为难民提供帮助的联合国机构

sentences.english: the Environmental Protection Agency
sentences.chinese: 环保局

detailed_translations.english: an organization or department, especially within a government, that does a specific job

sentences.english: There are obvious distinctions between the two wine-making areas.
sentences.chinese: 这两个酿酒区之间有明显的不同。

detailed_translations.english: a clear difference or separation between two similar things

name: genre
trans: 类型；流派（法语词，发音特殊）

sentences.english: a literary genre
sentences.chinese: 文学体裁

detailed_translations.chinese: 类型；种类；体裁；样式；流派；风俗画
detailed_translations.english: a particular type of art, writing, music etc, which has certain features that all examples of this type share

detailed_translations.chinese: 风俗画的；以日常情景为主题的

sentences.english: Both a staircase and a lift connect the two floors with an enclosed terrace on the roof.
sentences.chinese: 通过一道楼梯和一台电梯连接两层楼和封闭的屋顶平台。

sentences.english: Mirrored walls, skylights and large plated windows overlooking the garden and terrace fill this modern space with light.
sentences.chinese: 镜墙、天窗和大型的金属镀窗俯瞰花园和阳台，让这个现代空间充满光线。

detailed_translations.english: a flat outdoor area next to a building or on a roof, where you can sit outside to eat, relax etc

sentences.english: They riprapped the breakwater with stone.
sentences.chinese: 他们以乱石基巩固防波堤。

sentences.english: Back of the breakwater the dredger was working.
sentences.chinese: 在防波堤后面挖泥船正在工作。

sentences.english: The actual breakwater itself will be built on a foundation of slag—a permeable byproduct of steel which will provide a habitat for aquatic wildlife in the lake.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，防浪堤本身是建在矿渣（具有渗透性的钢铁的副产物）上的，这能为水中的生物营造良好的生活环境。

detailed_translations.english: a wall built out into the sea to protect the shore from the force of the waves

sentences.english: Recent studies show that women still get paid a lot less than men.
sentences.chinese: 最近的调查表明，女性的薪水仍比男性的要低很多。

sentences.english: The study was carried out between January and May 2008.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究是在 2008 年1月到5月间进行的。

sentences.english: Set aside a period of time specifically for study.
sentences.chinese: 留出一段时间专门用于学习

sentences.english: I’ve been studying English for six years
sentences.chinese: 我学英语已有六年了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 研究 (对某一课题或问题的)；中文释义: 学习 (尤指在家里或放学后的)
detailed_translations.english: a piece of work that is done to find out more about a particular subject or problem, and usually includes a written report

detailed_translations.chinese: 中文释义: 学习，攻读
detailed_translations.english: to learn about a subject at school, university etc

sentences.english: a useful technique for generating new ideas
sentences.chinese: 能产生新创意的有用技术

sentences.english: The program would generate a lot of new jobs.
sentences.chinese: 这个项目将创造许多新的就业岗位。

detailed_translations.english: to produce or cause something

sentences.english: Invaders ransacked the town.
sentences.chinese: 侵略军洗劫了小镇。

detailed_translations.english: a soldier or a group of soldiers that enters a country or town by force in order to take control of it

sentences.english: You've never approved of Henry, have you?
sentences.chinese: 你从未赞赏过亨利，是吧？

detailed_translations.english: to think that someone or something is good, right, or suitable

sentences.english: Farming is heavily subsidized (= subsidized a lot ) by the government.
sentences.chinese: 农业得到政府的大量补贴。

detailed_translations.chinese: 资助；给与奖助金；向…行贿
detailed_translations.english: if a government or organization subsidizes a company, activity etc, it pays part of its costs

sentences.english: ‘I don’t see why I should take the blame for this!’ she protested.
sentences.chinese: “我不明白为什么我要对此承担责任！”她抗议道。

detailed_translations.english: to come together to publicly express disapproval or opposition to something
something that you do to show publicly that you think that something is wrong and unfair, for example taking part in big public meetings, refusing to work, or refusing to buy a company’s products

sentences.english: We have to act within the existing legal framework.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须在现行的法律框架下行事。

detailed_translations.english: a set of ideas, rules, or beliefs from which something is developed, or on which decisions are based

sentences.english: He has to make a lot of after-dinner speeches .
sentences.chinese: 他经常要发表席后演说。

sentences.english: Collins gave the keynote speech (= most important speech ) .
sentences.chinese: 科林斯作了主题发言。

detailed_translations.chinese: 演讲；讲话；[语] 语音；演说
detailed_translations.english: a talk, especially a formal one about a particular subject, given to a group of people

sentences.english: Even moderate amounts of alcohol can be dangerous.
sentences.chinese: 喝酒即使不多也会有危险。

sentences.english: a moderate degree of success
sentences.chinese: 一定程度上的成功

sentences.english: a student of moderate ability
sentences.chinese: 能力一般的学生

sentences.english: Moderate exercise, such as walking, is recommended.
sentences.chinese: 建议适度锻炼，比如散步。

sentences.english: Bake the pie for 30 minutes in a moderate oven.
sentences.chinese: 馅饼用中火烘烤30分钟。

sentences.english: moderate to strong winds
sentences.chinese: 中到大风

detailed_translations.english: not very large or very small, very hot or very cold, very fast or very slow etc
someone whose opinions or beliefs, especially about politics, are not extreme and are considered reasonable by most people
to make something less extreme or violent, or to become less extreme or violent

sentences.english: The information you gave us was incorrect.
sentences.chinese: 你给我们的信息不准确。

detailed_translations.english: not correct or true

sentences.english: The coupon entitles you to ten cents off your next purchase.
sentences.chinese: 这张优惠券可以让你在下次购物时节省10分钱。

detailed_translations.chinese: 息票；赠券；联票；[经] 配给券
detailed_translations.english: a small piece of printed paper that gives you the right to pay less for something or get something free

sentences.english: Britain’s imperial expansion in the 19th century
sentences.chinese: 19世纪英帝国的扩张

detailed_translations.english: relating to an empire or to the person who rules it

sentences.english: The dominant male gorilla is the largest in the group.
sentences.chinese: 领头的公猩猩是这群大猩猩中体形最大的一个。

sentences.english: Japan became dominant in the mass market during the 1980s.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪80年代日本在大众市场上开始占据优势。

sentences.english: its dominant position within the group
sentences.chinese: 它在该组织中的突出地位

detailed_translations.chinese: 显性的；占优势的；支配的，统治的
detailed_translations.english: more powerful, important, or noticeable than other people or things

sentences.english: People are concerned about corruption and social inequality.
sentences.chinese: 人们对腐败和社会不公感到担忧。

detailed_translations.english: an unfair situation, in which some groups in society have more money, opportunities, power etc than others

sentences.english: the series of events that led to the outbreak of war
sentences.chinese: 导致战争爆发的一系列事件

sentences.english: The police are investigating a series of attacks in the area.
sentences.chinese: 警方在调查该地区发生的一连串袭击事件。

sentences.english: There’s been a whole series of accidents on this road.
sentences.chinese: 这条路上发生了一连串的交通事故。

detailed_translations.chinese: 一系列， 连续； 丛书， 连续剧
detailed_translations.english: several events or actions of a similar type that happen one after the other

sentences.english: Continue cooking until the meat is tender.
sentences.chinese: 把肉一直烧到松软为止。

detailed_translations.chinese: 嫩的；脆弱的；疼痛的，一触即痛的；温柔的
detailed_translations.english: tender food is easy to cut and eat, especially because it has been well cooked
to formally offer or show something to someone
a formal statement of the price you would charge for doing a job or providing goods or services

sentences.english: He may be prosecuted for revealing secrets about the security agency.
sentences.chinese: 他可能因泄露安全部门的机密而被起诉。

sentences.english: a test that can reveal a teacher’s hidden skills
sentences.chinese: 能够展现老师潜在技能的测试

detailed_translations.english: to make known something that was previously secret or unknown

sentences.english: You’re wrong, and I can prove it.
sentences.chinese: 你错了，我可以证明。

sentences.english: To prove his point (= show that he was right ) , he mentioned several other experiments which had produced similar results.
sentences.chinese: 为了证明自己的观点，他提到了另外几个结果相似的实验。

detailed_translations.english: to show that something is true by providing facts, information etc

sentences.english: An earthquake measuring 6.1 on the Richter scale struck southern California on June 28.
sentences.chinese: 6月28日加州南部地区发生了里氏6.1级地震。

sentences.english: The city is in an earthquake zone.
sentences.chinese: 该市位于地震带。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden shaking of the earth’s surface that often causes a lot of damage

sentences.english: The universe is infinite.
sentences.chinese: 宇宙是无限的。

detailed_translations.english: without limits in space or time

sentences.english: Sales of the drug will be suspended until more tests are completed.
sentences.chinese: 这种药品在完成进一步检验之前将暂停销售。

sentences.english: Talks between the two countries have now been suspended.
sentences.chinese: 两国间的对话现已中止。

detailed_translations.english: to officially stop something from continuing, especially for a short time

sentences.english: Before proceeding further, we must define our terms.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须先定义术语，然后再往下展开。

detailed_translations.english: to continue to do something that has already been planned or started

sentences.english: The immaculately tended gardens are an oasis in the midst of Cairo's urban sprawl.
sentences.chinese: 那些打理得非常整洁的花园是杂乱扩张的开罗市区中的一片绿洲。

detailed_translations.english: a place with water and trees in a desert

sentences.english: Instead of eating hunched pleasurably over a book, I look out of the window and chew every mouthful thoroughly, aware of every single oat and nut and dried bit of apple as it goes down.
sentences.chinese: 送孩子们去学校后，我不再放松地边吃早饭边看书，而是盯着窗外，仔细地嚼着嘴里的食物：每一粒燕麦、每一颗坚果、每一片苹果干。

sentences.english: For example, you may not think a bagel tastes salty, but a typical 4-inch (10-centimeter) oat-bran bagel has about 532 mg of sodium, and even a slice of whole-wheat bread contains 132 mg of sodium.
sentences.chinese: 例如百吉饼或许尝起来不咸，但一块普普通通的4英寸（10厘米）大的燕麦百吉饼却含将近532毫克的钠，而且即便一小块全麦面包也有132毫克钠。

detailed_translations.english: an erect annual grass, Avena sativa, grown in temperate regions for its edible seed

sentences.english: ...roast goose.
sentences.chinese: …烤鹅。

detailed_translations.english: the cooked meat of this bird

sentences.english: The song was dreary and repetitive.
sentences.chinese: 这首歌又枯燥又重复。

detailed_translations.english: done many times in the same way, and boring

sentences.english: a distribution centre
sentences.chinese: 经销中心

detailed_translations.english: the act of sharing things among a large group of people in a planned way

sentences.english: Out with every theory of human behavior, from linguistics to sociology.
sentences.chinese: 从语言学、社会学的人类行为原理里解脱吧。

sentences.chinese: 但是我是一名建筑师。

name: sticky
trans: 粘的；闷热的；令人不满意的

sentences.chinese: 在这一点上的所有方面的印表机系统的性能达到高潮。

sentences.english: Sarah rejected her brother’s offer of help.

sentences.chinese: 德克斯特断然拒绝让他辞职的要求。

sentences.english: His proposal was rejected outright (= completely rejected ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的建议被彻底否决了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拒绝； 拒纳， 退回， 摈弃
detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept, believe in, or agree with something

detailed_translations.chinese: 被拒货品， 不合格产品
detailed_translations.english: a product that has been rejected because there is something wrong with it

sentences.english: She rocked the cradle to quieten the child.
sentences.chinese: 她摇动摇篮，让宝宝安静下来。

sentences.english: Athens is often regarded as the cradle of democracy.
sentences.chinese: 雅典常常被认为是民主的发源地。

detailed_translations.english: a small bed for a baby, especially one that moves gently from side to side

sentences.english: He was stabbed to death in a fight.
sentences.chinese: 他在一次打斗中被捅死了。

detailed_translations.english: to push a knife into someone or something
an act of stabbing or trying to stab someone with a knife

sentences.english: Abruptly the group ahead of us came to a standstill.
sentences.chinese: 忽然我们前面的队伍停了下来。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which there is no movement or activity at all

sentences.english: She was always defending her husband in front of their daughter.
sentences.chinese: 她在女儿面前总是为丈夫辩解。

sentences.english: Students should be ready to explain and defend their views.
sentences.chinese: 学生应该勇于为自己的观点进行解释和辩护。

detailed_translations.english: to use arguments to protect something or someone from criticism, or to prove that something is right

sentences.english: She was wearing the perfume that he’d bought her.
sentences.chinese: 她擦了他买给她的香水。

detailed_translations.english: a liquid with a strong pleasant smell that women put on their skin or clothing to make themselves smell nice
to put perfume on something

sentences.english: a paper carrying the front-page headline: ‘Space Aliens meet with President’
sentences.chinese: 头版报道题为“天外来客会见总统”的报纸

detailed_translations.chinese: 大标题；内容提要；栏外标题；头版头条新闻
detailed_translations.english: the title of a newspaper report, which is printed in large letters above the report

detailed_translations.chinese: 给…加标题；使成为注意中心；大力宣传
detailed_translations.english: to give a headline to an article or story

sentences.english: a political controversy
sentences.chinese: 政治争议

sentences.english: the controversy surrounding Skinner’s theories
sentences.chinese: 围绕斯金纳的理论的争议

sentences.english: (= began ) over the use of the chemicals on crops.
sentences.chinese: 对庄稼施用化学品的做法引起了争论。

detailed_translations.english: a serious argument about something that involves many people and continues for a long time

sentences.english: a porcelain vase
sentences.chinese: 瓷花瓶

detailed_translations.english: a hard shiny white substance that is used for making expensive plates, cups etc

sentences.english: You need stamina to be a long-distance runner.
sentences.chinese: 当长跑运动员需要耐力。

sentences.english: Elaine has the stamina and the determination to succeed.
sentences.chinese: 伊莱恩具有成功所需的毅力和决心。

detailed_translations.english: physical or mental strength that lets you continue doing something for a long time without getting tired

sentences.english: At the end of the day, add up the percent DVs.
sentences.chinese: 在一天结束后，把所有营养素的百分比加起来。

sentences.english: Machines are delivering up to only 25 percent of the fuel they combust.
sentences.chinese: 机器的运转效率只能达到所耗燃料的百分之二十五。

sentences.english: But there are billions more people out there who are not in the top one percent, and they’re not in the top two or three either.
sentences.chinese: 但是还有十亿多的人不在其中，他们不在其中的百分之一，也不再其中的两百分之一或者三百分之一的其中。

sentences.english: He was a hard-working, honest man.
sentences.chinese: 他勤奋老实。

sentences.english: Ann had an honest face.
sentences.chinese: 安有一张诚实的面孔。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is honest always tells the truth and does not cheat or steal

sentences.english: a thick oak door
sentences.chinese: 一扇厚实的橡木门

sentences.english: a thick slice of homemade bread
sentences.chinese: 一片厚厚的自制面包

sentences.english: He was wearing thick glasses.
sentences.chinese: 他戴着厚厚的眼镜。

sentences.english: short thick fingers
sentences.chinese: 短粗的手指

sentences.english: thick wool socks (= socks that are heavy and warm )
sentences.chinese: 厚厚的羊毛袜子

sentences.english: If you want a thicker blanket, there are more here in the closet.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想要更厚的毯子，这个柜子里还有。

sentences.english: The meat is done when the thickest part turns from pink to white.
sentences.chinese: 肉最厚的部分从粉红色变成白色，就说明熟了。

detailed_translations.english: if something is thick, there is a large distance or a larger distance than usual between its two opposite surfaces or sides

sentences.english: His injuries were quite severe.
sentences.chinese: 他的伤势很严重。

sentences.english: She’s suffering from severe depression.
sentences.chinese: 她患有严重的抑郁症。

sentences.english: The US faces severe economic problems.
sentences.chinese: 美国面临严重的经济问题。

sentences.english: The storm caused severe damage.
sentences.chinese: 这场暴风雨造成了严重的破坏。

detailed_translations.chinese: 严重的； 严厉的， 严格的； 严峻的， 艰难的； 朴素的， 不加装饰的
detailed_translations.english: severe problems, injuries, illnesses etc are very bad or very serious

sentences.english: My father put all his money into stock market bonds.
sentences.chinese: 我父亲把他所有的钱都投在上市债券上。

sentences.english: furious trading on the bond market
sentences.chinese: 债券市场疯狂的交易

sentences.english: the emotional bond between mother and child
sentences.chinese: 母亲和孩子之间的感情纽带

detailed_translations.english: an official document promising that a government or company will pay back money that it has borrowed, often with interest

sentences.english: Her skin felt smooth and cool.
sentences.chinese: 她的皮肤摸上去又滑又凉。

sentences.english: a smooth pebble
sentences.chinese: 光滑的卵石

sentences.english: The stone steps had been worn smooth .
sentences.chinese: 石阶被磨得光溜溜的了。

sentences.english: She stood up and smoothed down her frock.
sentences.chinese: 她站了起来，抚平了自己的连衣裙。

detailed_translations.english: a smooth surface has no rough parts, lumps, or holes, especially in a way that is pleasant and attractive to touch

detailed_translations.chinese: 使光滑；消除（障碍等）；使优雅；缓和
detailed_translations.english: to make a rough surface flat and even
If you smooth something, you move your hands over its surface to make it smooth and flat

sentences.english: The disease originated in Africa.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病起源于非洲。

sentences.english: All carbohydrates originate from plants.
sentences.chinese: 所有的碳水化合物均来源于植物。

detailed_translations.english: When something originates or when someone originates it, it begins to happen or exist

detailed_translations.chinese: 创造， 创始， 开创
detailed_translations.english: to have the idea for something and start it

sentences.english: Both faculty and students oppose the measures.
sentences.chinese: 教师和学生都反对这些措施。

detailed_translations.english: all the teachers in a university

sentences.english: a polio vaccine
sentences.chinese: 小儿麻痹症疫苗

sentences.english: Doctors worried that there would not be enough vaccine for everyone who needed it.
sentences.chinese: 医生担心没有足够的疫苗给每个需要的人。

detailed_translations.english: a substance which contains a weak form of the bacteria or virus that causes a disease and is used to protect people from that disease

sentences.english: Puppies are naturally curious.
sentences.chinese: 小狗天生好奇。

sentences.english: He felt a curious mixture of excitement and panic.
sentences.chinese: 他有一种既兴奋又惊慌的奇怪感觉。

detailed_translations.english: wanting to know about something

sentences.english: Management have agreed to extend the deadline.
sentences.chinese: 管理层已同意延长最后期限。

detailed_translations.english: to continue for a longer period of time, or to make something last longer

sentences.english: New evidence has confirmed the first witness’s story.
sentences.chinese: 新的证据证实了第一个证人的说法。

sentences.english: To confirm my diagnosis I need to do some tests.
sentences.chinese: 为了证实我的诊断，我要做一些化验。

sentences.english: Could you confirm the dates we discussed?
sentences.chinese: 你能确认我们商讨过的日期吗？

sentences.english: After a six-month probationary period, her position was confirmed.
sentences.chinese: 经过六个月的试用期后，她获准正式担任该职。

detailed_translations.english: to state or show that sth is definitely true or correct, especially by providing evidence

sentences.english: Parking restrictions will be strictly enforced.
sentences.chinese: 停车限制将会严格执行。

sentences.english: It is unlikely that a record company would enforce its views on an established artist.
sentences.chinese: 唱片公司未必能强迫一位已出名的艺人接受他们的意见。

detailed_translations.english: to make people obey a rule or law

sentences.english: All visitors to the apartment building must be announced.
sentences.chinese: 那幢公寓楼的访客都必须通报。

sentences.english: After announcing himself at the reception desk, James was led upstairs.
sentences.chinese: 在接待处通报姓名后，詹姆斯被领上楼去。

detailed_translations.english: to officially tell people that someone has arrived at a particular place

sentences.english: Does your rent include utilities?
sentences.chinese: 你的房租包括公用事业费吗？

detailed_translations.chinese: 公用事业〔如煤气、电力等〕
detailed_translations.english: a service such as gas or electricity provided for people to use

sentences.english: Eight massive stone pillars supported the roof.
sentences.chinese: 八根巨大的石柱支撑起房顶。

sentences.english: Mr Fitzwilliam had been seen as a pillar of the community.
sentences.chinese: 菲茨威廉先生已被视为社区的骨干。

detailed_translations.english: a tall upright round post used as a support for a roof or bridge

sentences.english: Tickets are limited and will be allocated to those who apply first.
sentences.chinese: 票数有限，将分配给那些先申请的人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 分配； 分派， 把…拨给
detailed_translations.english: to use something for a particular purpose, give something to a particular person etc, especially after an official decision has been made

sentences.english: a cholera outbreak
sentences.chinese: 霍乱的爆发

detailed_translations.english: if there is an outbreak of fighting or disease in an area, it suddenly starts to happen

sentences.english: She tried to blow a grey strand of hair from her eyes.
sentences.chinese: 她试图吹开眼前的一缕白发。

sentences.english: The climbers had been stranded by a storm.
sentences.chinese: 这些登山者被暴风雨困住了。

detailed_translations.english: a single thin piece of thread, wire, hair etc
If you are stranded, you are prevented from leaving a place, for example because of bad weather

sentences.english: economic policies that threaten to undermine the health care system
sentences.chinese: 可能会损害医疗保健制度的经济政策

detailed_translations.english: to gradually make someone or something less strong or effective

sentences.english: ...a storeroom filled with massive old furniture covered with dust.
sentences.chinese: ...一间堆满了尘封的大件旧家具的贮藏室。

detailed_translations.english: a room where goods are stored

sentences.english: a new concept in business travel
sentences.chinese: 商务旅行的新理念

sentences.english: our basic concepts of decent human behaviour
sentences.chinese: 我们对得体的人类行为的基本观念

sentences.english: It’s very simple, once you grasp the concept .
sentences.chinese: 你一旦掌握了这个概念之后就很简单了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 概念， 观念； 设想
detailed_translations.english: an idea of how something is, or how something should be done

sentences.english: The quarterback sprinted toward the end zone with Jansen in hot pursuit (= following closely behind ) .
sentences.chinese: 那名四分卫快速冲向底线区，詹森穷追不舍。

detailed_translations.english: when someone tries to get, achieve, or find something in a determined way

sentences.english: I wouldn’t wish such a fate on my worst enemy.
sentences.chinese: 就算是我不共戴天的仇敌，我也不希望他遭遇这样的命运。

detailed_translations.english: the things that happen to someone or something, especially unpleasant things that end their existence or end a particular period

sentences.english: a ruthless dictator who eliminated all his rivals
sentences.chinese: 铲除所有异己的残酷独裁者

detailed_translations.english: to completely get rid of something that is unnecessary or unwanted

sentences.english: How did they diagnose you?
sentences.chinese: 他们怎么给你的诊断的？

sentences.english: What tools do you need to help you diagnose the problem, and where do you get them?
sentences.chinese: 您需要什么工具来帮助您诊断问题，可以从哪里获得这些工具？

sentences.english: Evidently this springs from some defect in their nature, but it is one not altogether easy either to diagnose of to cure.
sentences.chinese: 这种情形显然源于他们本性上的某种缺陷，但是这种缺陷既不容易诊断也不容易治疗。

detailed_translations.english: to find out what illness someone has, or what the cause of a fault is, after doing tests, examinations etc

sentences.english: The information given to the press was carefully censored by the Ministry of Defence.
sentences.chinese: 发布给报界的信息经过了国防部的仔细审查。

detailed_translations.english: to examine books, films, letters etc to remove anything that is considered offensive, morally harmful, or politically dangerous etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 检查员；[心理] 潜意识压抑力；信件检查员
detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to examine books, films, letters etc and remove anything considered to be offensive, morally harmful, or politically dangerous

sentences.english: Yeah, , now you know how the sex ratio matters!
sentences.chinese: 是的，现在你知道性别比例的问题了吧！ ！

sentences.english: The ratio could reach one in four within a year.
sentences.chinese: 一年之内这个比例可以达到四分之一。

sentences.english: When using profiling it is typical to consider only the ratio (or percentage) of time spent in certain areas.
sentences.chinese: 当使用分析时，它是典型的考虑时间花费在某些领域的比例（或百分比）。

detailed_translations.english: a relationship between two amounts, represented by a pair of numbers showing how much bigger one amount is than the other

sentences.english: At what age can you start drawing your pension ?
sentences.chinese: 从多少岁可以开始领取养老金？

sentences.english: If you are self-employed, you should think about taking out a private pension .
sentences.chinese: 如果你是自由职业者，应该考虑办理私人养老金事宜。

sentences.english: Many people find it hard to live on a basic state pension .
sentences.chinese: 许多人发现仅凭国家基本养老金不能养活自己。

sentences.english: She pays a quarter of her salary into a pension plan.
sentences.chinese: 她将每月工资的四分之一用于养老金计划。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money paid regularly by the government or company to someone who does not work any more, for example because they have reached the age when people stop working or because they are ill
to grant a pension to

sentences.english: So when you fry, bake, grill, or roast potatoes you could be generating potentially harmful carcinogens.
sentences.chinese: 因此当你油炸、烘烤、烧烤或者炒土豆时，有可能会产生有害的致癌物。

detailed_translations.english: the young of various species of fish
to cook something in hot fat or oil, or to be cooked in hot fat or oil

sentences.english: He hadn’t shaved for days.
sentences.chinese: 他已经好几天没刮脸了。

sentences.english: Brian had cut himself shaving .
sentences.chinese: 布赖恩刮胡子时割破了脸。

detailed_translations.english: to cut off hair very close to the skin, especially from the face, using a  razor

sentences.english: People with the virus may feel perfectly well, but they can still infect others.
sentences.chinese: 带有这种病毒的人可能毫无症状，却仍可能传染他人。

sentences.english: He thought they might infect others with their bourgeois ideas.
sentences.chinese: 他认为他们可能用中产阶级思想去影响别人。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone a disease

sentences.english: He lifted his T-shirt to expose a jagged scar across his chest.
sentences.chinese: 他撩起T恤衫，露出横贯胸部的锯齿状伤疤。

detailed_translations.english: to show something that is usually covered or hidden

sentences.english: a standard 50mm lens
sentences.chinese: 50毫米标准镜头

detailed_translations.chinese: 透镜， 镜片； 镜头
detailed_translations.english: the part of a camera through which the light travels before it reaches the film

sentences.english: Buckingham Palace
sentences.chinese: 白金汉宫

detailed_translations.english: the official home of a person of very high rank, especially a king or queen – often used in names

sentences.english: The water shed from the bathroom.
sentences.chinese: 水是从浴室中溢出来的。

sentences.english: We revamped our bathroom last month.
sentences.chinese: 我们在上个月装修了浴室。

sentences.english: My glasses steamed when I came into the bathroom.
sentences.chinese: 我走进浴室时，眼镜上蒙上了一层水气。

detailed_translations.english: a room where there is a bath or  shower  , a  basin  , and sometimes a toilet

sentences.english: He can come with us, provided he pays for his own meals.
sentences.chinese: 只要他付自己的饭钱，就可以跟我们一起来。

sentences.english: I sympathize with the introvert as I would with the sickly, but both are missing a lot of life.
sentences.chinese: 我会像体谅体弱病残的人那样，体谅性格内向的人，但两者都失去许多人生体验。

sentences.english: I sympathize with the introvert as I would with the sickly, but both are missing a lot of life.
sentences.chinese: 我同情那些内向的人正如我会同情病人一样，因为他们的生活中都有缺失的部分。

sentences.english: How do you think the introvert and the extrovert will behave in such an environment?
sentences.chinese: 在完全相同的环境下，你认为内向的人和外向的人都会如何表现呢？

detailed_translations.english: someone who is quiet and shy, and does not enjoy being with other people

sentences.english: Last year they sold twice as many computers as their competitors.
sentences.chinese: 去年他们的计算机销量是竞争对手的两倍。

detailed_translations.english: a person, team, company etc that is competing with another

sentences.english: The EU Council of Finance Ministers failed to reach a consensus on the pace of integration.
sentences.chinese: 欧盟财政部长会议未能就一体化的进度达成共识。

sentences.english: the current consensus of opinion
sentences.chinese: 目前观点上的一致

sentences.english: The general consensus was that technology was a good thing.
sentences.chinese: 大家都认为科技是好东西。

sentences.english: the consensus politics of the fifties
sentences.chinese: 50年代的共识政治

detailed_translations.english: an opinion that everyone in a group agrees with or accepts

sentences.english: The study found that some alcoholics had clear personality traits showing up early in childhood.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究发现一些酗酒者早在孩童时就表现出明显的个性特征。

detailed_translations.english: a particular quality in someone’s character

sentences.english: an annoying habit of interrupting
sentences.chinese: 打断他人讲话的讨厌习惯

sentences.english: The annoying thing is he’s usually right.
sentences.chinese: 令人气恼的是，他通常都是对的。

sentences.english: It’s annoying that we didn’t know about this before.
sentences.chinese: 令人恼火的是，我们以前并不知道这事。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel slightly angry

sentences.english: a tolerant society
sentences.chinese: 宽容的社会

sentences.english: trees that are tolerant of salt sea winds
sentences.chinese: 能耐海风的树木

detailed_translations.english: allowing people to do, say, or believe what they want without criticizing or punishing them

sentences.english: A smouldering cigarette can kindle a devastating bushfire.
sentences.chinese: 闷燃着的香烟会引起毁灭性的林区大火。

sentences.english: She imagined that she could be happy here, at least for as long as she could avoid any calamity like the bushfire that had chased her from her last home.
sentences.chinese: 她想自己会在这里住得很开心，至少住到她能躲避丛林大火之类的灾难，上一回搬家就是因为一场丛林大火。

sentences.english: All we need for a little perspective at the moment (Feb, 2009) is to watch the TV (here in Australia) and listen to the bushfire survivors talk for a few minutes.
sentences.chinese: 当时（2009年2月），我们需要的一个小小的思考就是看电视（在澳大利亚），听森林大火的幸存者讲述的那些时间。

detailed_translations.english: an uncontrolled fire in the bush; a scrub or forest fire

sentences.english: Mr Smith has walked straight into a trap laid by the Tories.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯先生直接落入了保守党布设的圈套。

sentences.english: He felt he had been trapped into accepting the terms of the contract.
sentences.chinese: 他觉得自己是中了圈套才接受这合同条款的。

sentences.english: Were you just trying to trap her into making some admission?
sentences.chinese: 你仅仅是在试图诱骗她招供吗？

detailed_translations.english: a clever trick that is used to catch someone or to make them do or say something that they did not intend to
to trick sb into sth

sentences.english: a bird’s nest
sentences.chinese: 鸟窝

sentences.english: In May the females build a nest and lay their eggs.
sentences.chinese: 雌鸟在5月份筑巢产蛋。

sentences.english: Young eagles leave the nest after only two months.
sentences.chinese: 雏鹰仅仅两个月以后就会飞离鸟巢。

detailed_translations.english: a place made or chosen by a bird to lay its eggs in and to live in
to build or use a nest

sentences.english: We’re looking for someone with an outgoing personality.
sentences.chinese: 我们在找一个性格外向的人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 外出的， 离开的； 即将离职的； 友好的， 好交际的； 外向的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is outgoing likes to meet and talk to new people

sentences.english: All the main economic indicators suggest that trade is improving.
sentences.chinese: 所有主要的经济指标都表明贸易情况正在改善。

detailed_translations.chinese: 指示器；[试剂] 指示剂；[计] 指示符；压力计

sentences.english: Fold the paper along the dotted line.

sentences.english: The trader was obstinate in the negotiation.
sentences.chinese: 这个商人在谈判中拗强固执。

detailed_translations.english: official discussions between the repre­sentatives of opposing groups who are trying to reach an agreement, especially in business or politics

sentences.english: a wash basin
sentences.chinese: 洗脸盆

sentences.english: Fill the basin with the cake mixture.
sentences.chinese: 在盆里装入蛋糕拌料。

sentences.english: countries around the Pacific Basin
sentences.chinese: 太平洋盆地周围的国家

sentences.chinese: 那则信息不归我们所有。

sentences.english: How did the painting come into your possession (= how did you get it ) ?

sentences.chinese: 这家金融公司目前拥有这所房子。

detailed_translations.english: if something is in your possession, you own it, or you have obtained it from somewhere

sentences.english: species in danger of extinction
sentences.chinese: 有灭绝危险的物种

sentences.english: They were hunted almost to extinction.
sentences.chinese: 它们遭受猎杀，几近灭绝。

sentences.english: Conservationists are trying to save the whale from extinction.

detailed_translations.english: when a particular type of animal or plant stops existing

sentences.english: The grassy plain gave way to an extensive swamp.
sentences.chinese: 青草覆盖的平原被广阔的沼泽地所取代。

sentences.english: the vast plains of central China
sentences.chinese: 华中地区的广阔平原

sentences.english: The advantages were plain to see.
sentences.chinese: 优势显而易见。

detailed_translations.english: a large area of flat dry land
very clear, and easy to understand or recognize

sentences.english: How much do you want to bet?
sentences.chinese: 你想赌多少钱？

sentences.english: a £50 bet
sentences.chinese: 50英镑的赌注

an agreement to risk money on the result of a race, game etc or on something happening, or the money that you risk

sentences.english: The governor gave only a vague outline of his tax plan.
sentences.chinese: 州长只是含糊地大致说了一下他的税务计划。

sentences.english: I didn’t like Dev, and the feeling seemed to be mutual.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜欢德夫，他好像也不喜欢我。

sentences.english: The two men were a mutual admiration society , gushing about how much they were learning from each other.

sentences.english: a communal bathroom
sentences.chinese: 一个公用浴室

detailed_translations.english: shared by a group of people or animals, especially a group who live together

sentences.chinese: 我从孩子们的眼神中看到了期盼。

sentences.english: Uncle Ted’s chair collapsed under his weight.
sentences.chinese: 椅子承受不了特德叔叔的重量，塌架了。

sentences.english: The roof had collapsed long ago.
sentences.chinese: 屋顶早就塌了。

detailed_translations.english: if a building, wall etc collapses, it falls down suddenly, usually because it is weak or damaged

sentences.english: The grief she felt over Helen’s death was almost unbearable.
sentences.chinese: 她因海伦的去世而悲痛难当。

detailed_translations.english: extreme sadness, especially because someone you love has died

sentences.english: a nuclear missile
sentences.chinese: 核导弹

sentences.english: a missile attack
sentences.chinese: 导弹袭击

sentences.english: He looked very pale and drawn.
sentences.chinese: 他看上去非常苍白憔悴。

sentences.chinese: 淡蓝色的窗帘

detailed_translations.chinese: 苍白的,灰白的；浅的,暗淡的
detailed_translations.english: having a skin colour that is very white, or whiter than it usually is

sentences.english: Genet started as a rebel, but soon became part of the literary mainstream.
sentences.chinese: 热内起初很叛逆，但不久就回归了文学主流。

detailed_translations.english: the most usual ideas or methods, or the people who have these ideas or methods

sentences.english: All the flats in the building had the same layout.
sentences.chinese: 大楼里所有的公寓布局都是一样的。

detailed_translations.english: the way in which something such as a town, garden, or building is arranged

sentences.english: I tried to visualize the house while he was describing it.
sentences.chinese: 我一边听他描述，一边想象那房子的样子。

detailed_translations.english: to form a picture of someone or something in your mind

sentences.chinese: 现在，顶部图层应当有小箭头指向下面的图层。

sentences.chinese: 山上的炮楼把下面的海港地区置于射程之内。

sentences.english: They must all be drowning beneath him, in the watery caves of the rock!
sentences.chinese: 他们一定是在他下面的水里，就在那岩石充满了水的洞中游泳了！

sentences.english: Oil is refined to remove naturally occurring impurities.
sentences.chinese: 油经过提炼去除天然生成的杂质。

sentences.english: We tried everything – persuasion, bribery, threats.
sentences.chinese: 我们什么都试过——劝过，给过好处，也威胁过。

sentences.english: He was found guilty of bribery and corruption (=  bribery and dishonest behaviour  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他被判犯有贿赂和徇私舞弊罪。

detailed_translations.english: the act of giving bribes

name: isolate
trans: 隔离；使孤立；孤立的；单独的

sentences.english: The town was isolated by the floods.
sentences.chinese: 洪水使该镇与外界隔绝。

sentences.english: The US has sought to isolate Cuba both economically and politically.
sentences.chinese: 美国一直想在经济和政治上孤立古巴。

detailed_translations.english: to separate one person, group, or thing from other people or things

sentences.english: We watched the waves crashing against the rocks.
sentences.chinese: 我们看着海浪哗啦哗啦地冲击岩石。

sentences.chinese: 盘子哗啦一声摔落到地上。

to have an accident in a car, plane etc by violently hitting something else
a sudden loud noise made by something falling, breaking etc

sentences.english: When the investigation is concluded, the results will be sent to the US Attorney’s office.
sentences.chinese: 等到调查结束后，结果会被送到联邦检察官办公室。

sentences.chinese: 弗朗西斯完成了和詹姆斯的买卖后就去了迈阿密。

detailed_translations.english: to decide that something is true after considering all the information you have

sentences.chinese: 加糖的醋是从甘蔗和松木中精炼出来的.

sentences.chinese: 在烹饪中，醋可以单独食用，也可以用作食物调味料不附加任何卡路里，但如果我们把它涂抹到头发上呢？

sentences.chinese: 玛丽•雪莱创作《科学怪人》这部恐怖小说名作的时候年仅18岁。

sentences.chinese: 使这家公司在竞争中脱颖而出的是其客户服务。

sentences.chinese: 露西伸长了脖子去亲吻他的脸颊。

sentences.chinese: 他的死是个无情的打击。

sentences.chinese: 有时候生活残酷得让人无法承受。

sentences.chinese: 他的山地自行车有18挡。

sentences.chinese: 安迪挂着三挡小心地行驶。

sentences.chinese: 谁都能骑上难爬的山坡，只要换挡就行了。

sentences.chinese: 我的训练是为赢得金牌去规划的。

sentences.chinese: 她坚持要大家聚在一起吃晚餐。

trans: 眼眶；轨迹；势力范围；进入轨道

sentences.chinese: 火星和地球的轨道随着时间而发生改变。

sentences.english: raw meat

sentences.english: grated raw carrots
sentences.chinese: 磨碎的生胡萝卜

sentences.chinese: 洋白菜可以生吃。

sentences.english: raw sugar
sentences.chinese: 原糖

trans: 生产的；有成效的；多产的

sentences.chinese: 该经济体的生产能力

detailed_translations.english: relating to the production of goods, crops, or wealth

sentences.chinese: 购物和做家务之类的日常琐事

sentences.chinese: 我们分担家务。

detailed_translations.english: a small job that you have to do regularly, especially work that you do to keep a house clean

sentences.english: I’m worried about washing that shirt in case it shrinks.
sentences.chinese: 我不太敢洗那件衬衫，怕它会缩水。

detailed_translations.chinese: 起皱； 收缩； 退缩， 畏缩
detailed_translations.english: to become smaller, or to make something smaller, through the effects of heat or water

sentences.english: a loose floorboard
sentences.chinese: 松动的地板

sentences.english: This tooth feels very loose.
sentences.chinese: 这颗牙感觉松动得厉害。

sentences.english: The screw has come loose (= become loose ) .
sentences.chinese: 螺丝松了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 宽松的；散漫的；不牢固的；不精确的
detailed_translations.english: not firmly fastened in place

sentences.english: The tornado rubbished the whole village.
sentences.chinese: 龙卷风毁掉了整个村庄。

sentences.english: The tornado disrupted broadcasting along the entire coast.
sentences.chinese: 龙卷风使整个沿海的广播都中断了。

sentences.english: The tornado is coming, so we had better batten down the hatches here and get to the cellar.
sentences.chinese: 龙卷风即将来临，因此我们最好把这里的舱口封上，到地下室去。

sentences.chinese: 教师们将被要求填写一份调查问卷。

detailed_translations.english: a written set of questions which you give to a large number of people in order to collect information

sentences.english: a frying pan
sentences.chinese: 炒锅

sentences.english: pots and pans
sentences.chinese: 锅碗瓢盆

sentences.english: Cook the pasta in a large pan of boiling water.
sentences.chinese: 把意大利面放在一大锅开水里煮。

detailed_translations.chinese: 平底锅；盘状的器皿；淘盘子，金盘，秤盘
detailed_translations.english: a round metal container that you use for cooking, usually with one long handle and a lid

detailed_translations.english: to wash soil in a metal container in order to separate gold from other substances

sentences.english: This species of plant is becoming increasingly rare.
sentences.chinese: 这种植物越来越罕见。

sentences.english: I only saw Helen on the rare occasions when I went into her shop.
sentences.chinese: 我只有偶尔去海伦店里时才会见到她。

sentences.english: It is very rare for her to miss a day at school.
sentences.chinese: 她很少有哪一天不上学的。

detailed_translations.english: not seen or found very often, or not happening very often

sentences.english: The college has revised its plans because of local objections.
sentences.chinese: 由于地方上的反对，学院已经修改了计划。

sentences.english: We have revised our estimates of population growth.
sentences.chinese: 我们已修正了对人口增长的估计。

detailed_translations.english: to change something because of new information or ideas

sentences.english: the lines on her forehead
sentences.chinese: 她前额上的皱纹

detailed_translations.english: the part of your face above your eyes and below your hair

sentences.english: The court ruled that the contract must be terminated.
sentences.chinese: 法庭裁决该合同必须终止。

sentences.english: to terminate a pregnancy (= to perform or have an abortion )
sentences.chinese: 终止妊娠（堕胎）

detailed_translations.english: ito end; to make sth end

sentences.english: He studied his map, trying to memorize the way to Rose's street.
sentences.chinese: 他研究了地图，努力记住去罗丝家那条街的路。

detailed_translations.english: to learn words, music etc so that you know them perfectly

sentences.english: The woman greeted us with a nod of the head.
sentences.chinese: 那个女人向我们点点头打招呼。

sentences.english: I showed the doorman my card and he gave a friendly nod.
sentences.chinese: 我向门卫出示了卡片，他友善地点了点头。

detailed_translations.english: an act of nodding
to move your head up and down, especially in order to show agreement or understanding

sentences.english: The scandal did his career a lot of harm.
sentences.chinese: 丑闻对他的职业生涯造成很大损害。

sentences.english: Our children deserve protection from harm.
sentences.chinese: 我们的儿童理应得到保护免受伤害。

sentences.english: chemicals that harm the environment
sentences.chinese: 损害环境的化学品

detailed_translations.english: damage, injury, or trouble caused by someone’s actions or by an event
to have a bad effect on something

sentences.english: If the company was to relocate, most employees would move.
sentences.chinese: 如果公司要迁移，大多数员工得搬家。

detailed_translations.english: if a person or business relocates, or if they are relocated, they move to a different place

sentences.english: He leant against her so heavily that she could barely sustain his weight.
sentences.chinese: 他重重地靠在她身上，让她几乎撑不住了。

sentences.english: Which planets can sustain life?
sentences.chinese: 哪些行星可以维持生命的存在？

detailed_translations.english: to hold up the weight of something

sentences.english: several cases of child abuse
sentences.chinese: 数宗虐待儿童案

sentences.english: An independent committee will look into alleged human rights abuses.
sentences.chinese: 一个独立委员会将对涉嫌践踏人权的行为进行调查。

detailed_translations.english: cruel or violent treatment of someone
to deliberately use something for the wrong purpose or for your own advantage

sentences.english: He was arrested and charged with murder.
sentences.chinese: 他遭到逮捕并被指控谋杀。

sentences.english: I got arrested for careless driving.
sentences.chinese: 我因鲁莽驾驶被捕。

sentences.english: drugs used to arrest the spread of the disease
sentences.chinese: 用于控制疾病蔓延的药物

detailed_translations.english: if the police arrest someone, the person is taken to a  police station  because the police think they have done something illegal

sentences.english: He received a six-month suspension for unprofessional behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 他因有违职业道德的行为被停职六个月。

detailed_translations.english: when something is officially stopped for a period of time

sentences.english: The judge cited a 1956 Supreme Court ruling in her decision.
sentences.chinese: 法官在她的判决中引用了1956年最高法院的一项裁决。

sentences.english: The passage cited above is from a Robert Frost poem.
sentences.chinese: 以上的引文出自罗伯特•弗罗斯特的一首诗。

sentences.english: She was cited in the divorce proceedings.
sentences.chinese: 她在离婚诉讼中被传唤。

detailed_translations.chinese: 引证；引用；〔法院〕传召，传讯
detailed_translations.english: to mention something as an example, especially one that supports, proves, or explains an idea or situation

sentences.english: a giant electronics company
sentences.chinese: 一家电子产品巨头

sentences.english: a giant tortoise
sentences.chinese: 巨龟

detailed_translations.english: extremely big, and much bigger than other things of the same type

detailed_translations.chinese: 巨人，巨物；才智超群的人
detailed_translations.english: an extremely tall strong man, who is often bad and cruel, in children’s stories

sentences.english: I'll just wipe the table.
sentences.chinese: 我只擦擦桌子。

detailed_translations.english: to remove liquid, dirt, or marks by wiping
a wiping movement with a cloth

sentences.english: We were each handed a badge with our name on it.
sentences.chinese: 我们每个人都拿到一个徽章，上面有我们的名字。

sentences.english: He now sees his wartime injuries as a badge of honor.
sentences.chinese: 现在，他把自己在战争中受的伤看成是一种光荣标记。

sentences.chinese: 由于地理上的隔绝，该地区发展了自己独特的文化。

sentences.chinese: 这一整章可以压缩成几个段落。

sentences.chinese: 禽类是由爬虫类进化而来，所以，第一只禽鸟肯定是从爬虫类孵化的蛋里出来的。

sentences.chinese: 这种身长只有10厘米小型爬行动物，可以在沙子中以最快每秒15厘米的速度游动。

sentences.chinese: 用餐后，她开始弹奏起竖琴让我们饮酒消食。

sentences.chinese: 我从未学习过如何为竖琴调弦，也不知如何弹奏鲁特琴。 但我懂得如何使一座偏僻的无名小镇发展成辉煌而伟大的城市，使世界各国的子民前来朝圣。
