sentences.chinese: 这一提议得到了压倒性多数的支持。

sentences.english: The British Air Force succeeded despite overwhelming odds against them.
sentences.chinese: 英国空军虽然处境极为不利，但还是完成了任务。

detailed_translations.english: very large or greater, more important etc than any other

name: sensible
trans: 明智的；实际的；可觉察的

sentences.english: She seems very sensible.
sentences.chinese: 她好像很明智。

sentences.english: sensible advice
sentences.chinese: 合理的建议

sentences.english: It’s sensible to keep a note of your passport number.
sentences.chinese: 把你的护照号码记下来是明智的。

sentences.english: Moving house seemed like the sensible thing to do .
sentences.chinese: 搬家似乎是明智的做法。

detailed_translations.english: reasonable, practical, and showing good judgment

sentences.english: exotic birds
sentences.chinese: 外国的奇异鸟类

sentences.english: exotic places
sentences.chinese: 有异国风情的地方

detailed_translations.chinese: 异国的；外来的；异国情调的
detailed_translations.english: something that is exotic seems unusual and interesting because it is related to a foreign country – use this to show approval

sentences.english: I hoped he would stop asking awkward questions .
sentences.chinese: 我希望他不要再问令人难堪的问题。

sentences.english: There was an awkward moment when she didn’t know whether to shake his hand or kiss his cheek.
sentences.chinese: 她不知道是该跟他握手还是亲他的脸颊，一时很尴尬。

sentences.english: an awkward silence
sentences.chinese: 令人尴尬的沉默

sentences.english: A laugh can help people over an awkward situation.
sentences.chinese: 笑可以助人化解尴尬。

sentences.english: Philip’s remarks put her in an awkward position (=  made it difficult for her to know what to do  ) .
sentences.chinese: 菲利普的话使她很窘迫。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel embarrassed so that you are not sure what to do or say

sentences.english: the Supreme Allied Commander in Europe
sentences.chinese: 欧洲盟军最高指挥官

sentences.english: a country where the car reigns supreme
sentences.chinese: 汽车占绝对优势地位的国家

detailed_translations.chinese: 最高的；至高的；最重要的
detailed_translations.english: having the highest position of power, importance, or influence

sentences.english: to resist change
sentences.chinese: 抵制变革

sentences.english: He tried to pin me down, but I resisted.
sentences.chinese: 他试图制伏我，但我奋力反抗。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept sth and try to stop it from happening
if you address a problem, you start trying to solve it

name: initiative
trans: 自发的；首创精神；主动权

sentences.english: I wish my son would show more initiative.
sentences.chinese: 我希望我的儿子能表现得再主动一些。

sentences.english: Don’t keep asking me for advice. Use your initiative.
sentences.chinese: 别老是要我给你出主意，发挥一下你自己的决断能力吧。

sentences.english: Lt. Carlos was not obeying orders. He acted on his own initiative (= he was not told what to do ).
sentences.chinese: 卡洛斯中尉没有服从命令，而是自作主张。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to make decisions and take action without waiting for someone to tell you what to do

sentences.english: You need special authorization to park here.
sentences.chinese: 在此停车要有特别的许可。

sentences.english: Children may not leave the building without the authorization of the principal.
sentences.chinese: 没有校长的许可，孩子们不能离开这幢楼。

detailed_translations.english: official permission to do something, or the document giving this permission

sentences.english: We chose a few of the commonest lexical items in the languages.
sentences.chinese: 我们选取了各语言中最常见的几个词汇。

detailed_translations.chinese: 词汇的；[语] 词典的；词典编纂的
detailed_translations.english: dealing with words, or related to words

sentences.english: The committee deferred their decision .
sentences.chinese: 委员会延期作出决定。

detailed_translations.english: to delay something until a later date

sentences.english: a shopping spree
sentences.chinese: 疯狂购物

detailed_translations.english: a short period of time when you do a lot of one activity, especially spending money or drinking alcohol

sentences.english: The statue was unveiled by the Queen.
sentences.chinese: 这尊雕塑由女王揭幕。

detailed_translations.english: to remove the cover from something, especially as part of a formal ceremony

sentences.english: Clean out the bathtub when you are done.
sentences.chinese: 洗完澡后请把浴缸洗干净。

sentences.english: His students are generally much better at bathtub dynamics by the end of his course, which gives him hope.
sentences.chinese: 在完成他的课程之后，他的学生对浴缸动力学的理解普遍好多了，这给了他希望。

sentences.english: And the neighbor down the street found in the bathtub… And the kid who ran his motorcycle into a tree an accident but for the note left behind saying that's exactly what he intended to do… And so on.
sentences.chinese: 还有那个街上的邻居，被人发现在浴缸里自杀了……还记着有个小年轻骑摩托车撞到了树上，大家认为这是个意外，但是这个小孩留的字条上说他是一心寻死的，等等。

detailed_translations.english: a long large container that you fill with water and sit or lie in to wash yourself

sentences.english: a one-year cookery course
sentences.chinese: 为期一年的烹饪课程

sentences.english: French cookery
sentences.chinese: 法式烹调

detailed_translations.english: the art or skill of cooking

sentences.english: They have decided to initiate legal proceedings against the newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 他们决定向该报提起法律诉讼。

sentences.english: Intellectuals have initiated a debate on terrorism.
sentences.chinese: 知识分子就恐怖主义发起了辩论。

detailed_translations.chinese: 开始， 创造， 发起； 使初步了解； 接纳， 让…加入
detailed_translations.english: to arrange for something important to start, such as an official process or a new plan
someone who has been allowed to join a particular organization, club, or group and has been taught its secrets

sentences.english: Her persistence paid off when she was offered the job of manager.
sentences.chinese: 她得到了经理的职位，不懈坚持终于有了回报。

sentences.english: ‘Why can’t I come?’ repeated Will with dogged persistence .
sentences.chinese: “我为什么不能去？”威尔不死心地又问了一遍。

detailed_translations.english: determination to do something even though it is difficult or other people oppose it

sentences.english: ancient pagan rituals
sentences.chinese: 古老的异教仪式

sentences.english: the importance of religion and ritual in our lives
sentences.chinese: 我们生活中宗教和宗教仪式的重要性

sentences.english: The lady of the house performs the sacred ritual of lighting two candles.
sentences.chinese: 由女主人来完成点燃两根蜡烛的神圣仪式。

detailed_translations.english: a ceremony that is always performed in the same way, in order to mark an important religious or social occasion

sentences.english: She felt a tap on her shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 她觉得有人轻轻拍了拍她的肩膀。

sentences.english: I went up and tapped on the window.
sentences.chinese: 我走上去轻轻敲敲窗户。

detailed_translations.english: an act of hitting something lightly, especially to get someone’s attention
to hit your fingers lightly on something, for example to get someone’s attention

sentences.english: It was their serenity which galled her most.
sentences.chinese: 最让她恼怒的是他们的平静。

sentences.english: He thought of her serenity as a foil for his intemperance.
sentences.chinese: 在他看来，她的平静反衬出了他的放纵。

sentences.english: He attacks your purity with lust, and he attacks your serenity with worry.
sentences.chinese: 他攻击欲望你的纯度，他用焦虑攻击你的宁平静。

sentences.english: How much time have you assigned for the meeting?
sentences.chinese: 你给这个会议定了多长时间？

detailed_translations.chinese: 指派， 分配； 布置； 指定
detailed_translations.english: to give someone a particular job or make them responsible for a particular person or thing

sentences.english: the first ascent of Qomolangma
sentences.chinese: 首次攀登珠穆朗玛峰

detailed_translations.english: the act of climbing something or moving upwards

sentences.english: She didn’t have the courage to admit to her deception.
sentences.chinese: 她没有勇气承认自己的欺骗行为。

sentences.english: He was convicted of obtaining money by deception .
sentences.chinese: 他被判犯有诈骗钱财罪。

detailed_translations.english: the act of deliberately making someone believe something that is not true

sentences.english: 57 percent complained of work overload.
sentences.chinese: 57%的人抱怨工作负担过重。

detailed_translations.english: too much of sth

sentences.english: alcoholic drinks
sentences.chinese: 酒精饮料

detailed_translations.english: relating to alcohol or containing alcohol
someone who regularly drinks too much alcohol and has difficulty stopping

sentences.english: the National Federation of Women’s Institutes
sentences.chinese: 〔英国及英联邦国家〕妇女协会全国联合会

detailed_translations.chinese: 联合；联邦；联盟；联邦政府
detailed_translations.english: a group of organizations, clubs, or people that have joined together to form a single group

sentences.english: He grins, delighted at the memory.
sentences.chinese: 想起往事，他咧嘴笑了。

detailed_translations.english: to smile widely
a wide smile

sentences.english: Nora was an excellent gymnast in this country.
sentences.chinese: 诺拉是这个国家卓越的体操运动员。

sentences.english: I was 26 by then -- which is ancient for a male gymnast.
sentences.chinese: 我那时26岁，作为一名男子体操运动员已经太老了。

sentences.english: Ah, the perspective of the proud gymnast.
sentences.chinese: 嘿，自以为是的体操运动员的观点。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is good at gymnastics and competes against other people in gymnastics competitions

sentences.english: artistic work
sentences.chinese: 艺术作品

sentences.english: Opinion about the artistic merit of his paintings has been mixed.
sentences.chinese: 对于他的绘画作品的艺术价值，人们褒贬不一。

detailed_translations.english: relating to art or culture

sentences.english: We heard a lion roar.
sentences.chinese: 我们听到狮子在吼叫。

sentences.english: The engines roared.
sentences.chinese: 引擎轰鸣。

sentences.english: ‘Get out of my house!’ he roared.
sentences.chinese: “从我家里滚出去！”他吼道。

sentences.english: the roar of the crowd
sentences.chinese: 人群的喊叫声

detailed_translations.english: to make a deep, very loud noise
a deep, loud noise made by an animal such as a lion, or by someone’s voice

sentences.english: little girls with ribbons in their hair
sentences.chinese: 头发上系着丝带的小姑娘们

sentences.english: a bundle of letters tied with pale blue ribbon
sentences.chinese: 一捆用淡蓝色丝带扎好的信

sentences.english: The ribbon was cut and the new station was officially open.
sentences.chinese: 剪彩后，新车站正式开始运营。

detailed_translations.chinese: 带；缎带；（勋章等的）绶带；带状物；勋表
detailed_translations.english: a narrow piece of attractive cloth that you use, for example, to tie your hair or hold things together

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…撕成条带；用缎带装饰

sentences.english: a patent lock
sentences.chinese: 专利锁

sentences.english: He held a number of patents for his many innovations.
sentences.chinese: 他为他的许多革新申请了几项专利。

detailed_translations.english: protected by a patent
A patent is an official right to be the only person or company allowed to make or sell a new product for a certain period of time.

sentences.english: The gases are stored in cylinders.
sentences.chinese: 气体储存在圆筒内。

sentences.english: a four-cylinder engine
sentences.chinese: 四汽缸引擎

detailed_translations.english: a shape, object, or container with circular ends and long straight sides
